title: An Introduction to Post-Quantum Cryptography Algorithms
excerpt: Current encryption methods will likely be broken by 2030. Embedded systems in development now will have a reasonable chance of encountering attacks.

title: Breaking RSA with a Quantum Computer - Schneier on Security
What are quantum-resistant algorithms—and why do we need them?
excerpt: When quantum computers become powerful enough, they could theoretically crack the encryption algorithms that keep us safe. The race is on to find new ones.

title: How Classical Cryptography Will Survive Quantum Computers

title: How a quantum computer could break 2048-bit RSA encryption in 8 hours | MIT
excerpt: A new study shows that quantum technology will catch up with today’s encryption standards much sooner than expected. That should worry anybody who needs to store data securely for 25 years or so.

title: The quest for quantum-proof encryption just made a leap forward
excerpt: Quantum computers could make encryption a thing of the past, but 15 contenders are trying to prove they have what it takes to safeguard your data.
